intro: Fedia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled fedia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are usually alternate and pinnately arranged. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or greenish in color. Fedia paniculata typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
